utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: What brings you in today?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Hi, I am just coming in because for the last couple of months but I've been having this, these coughing fits. Are there like when I'm going to the gym or even at home, like during the weekends when we're vacuuming and cleaning the house.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: When did this start?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um, I would say started, uh probably 3 months back, but it's gotten worse, so like before I used to like just have some irritation in my throat and cough a little, but now, I would say probably every other day I'm having these episodes where I can't stop coughing when I'm exercising.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Hmm, um and is this cough a dry cough, or do you bring up some mucus?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: It's usually, it's usually a dry cough and sometimes I do bring up like this light material, but usually it's mostly a dry cough.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: You never notice any blood, right?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, no blood.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK and uhm, it started about three months ago, I guess before that did you ever have a problem when you would exercise or when you were vacuuming or cleaning, has this been a problem that has occurred for years and that's just something that you that got worse and now it's come to your attention? Or was it just very new and sudden, three months ago?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um, it's fairly new. I've never really had this issue before although I have been like so like after the new year in the winter I, I, I wasn't much of the person who ran or exercised a lot. But I, I kind of needed a new goal to become more fit and active. So I notice that, I don't know, maybe that's why like, it is something new that I've been trying, but yeah, it's not been an issue before.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and other than the the cough, have you noticed any other symptoms like a sore throat or itchy eyes? Itchy nose? Stuffy nose or runny nose? Anything like that?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, none of those, but I did it, initially I used to get just an irritation in my throat. But now it's just more of a cough.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. Do you have, do you get any pain in your chest at all?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh, when I'm usually it goes away in 10-15 minutes but when I'm coughing a lot I do get some tightness.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. Do you ever feel like you're short of breath when you're coughing or otherwise?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I do find that it's harder to take a breath at those times.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Ok. Uhm and how long do these last for? Episodes last for?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Probably, uh 15 to 20 minutes and yeah, it's it's mainly just after I like often times over the last few weeks I've had to just stop doing what I'm doing, like exercising and just come home and rest.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Do you feel like your hearts beating really fast when that happens or you're sweating?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, yeah, I I feel like it's usually, I don't know if it's because of the exercise, but I have like a Fitbit and it's my my heart rate is much faster.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Uhm, OK. Alright. Have you had any other symptoms so anything, any pain in your belly or any nausea or vomiting?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, nothing like that.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Any changes in your bowel movements or any urinary symptoms?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Nope.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Any headaches or fevers or chills?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, nothing like that.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Unintentional weight loss?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Any night sweats?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Muscle aches, joint pain?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Have you been diagnosed with any medical conditions?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, I've I've been very healthy.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Uhm, you mentioned that you started going to the gym more often earlier this year, and that is when you sort of notice some of these symptoms? Is there anything else that changed in your life? Any big changes that you think could be related to this?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um no, not really, I've I've been really, umm, I moved back to my parents' home just for a bit right now.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Ok.

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Now, while the University has closed down, and by that I've lived there all my life before, so I don't know if that had anything to do with it.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Do you feel like they may have put new curtains or or like there's old carpets or new a new pet, or something that could have caused some irritation for you?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, but I have noticed that when I when we vacuum. I, I do get some of those symptoms as well. Just more of an irritation mores than the cough.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. OK, and do you feel that you're particularly anxious when these episodes are occurring? Do you have any new stressors in life?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh, no, not really.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Any medical conditions that run in the family?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uhm, I don't think so. Not that I know of.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and I guess a little bit more about you. So have you had in the past when you were younger, did you have a rash like eczema or did you have allergic rhinitis where you would sneeze and, to feel ill when you were outside or at certain times of the year? Anything like that?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I didn't have a, I didn't have any like exam or rashes, but I do generally have umm, get allergies during the spring time when I go outside.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Do you take any medications for that?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I just take Reactine usually during the spring.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Do you have any other allergies? To food or medications?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, not that I know.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: And other than Reactine, do you take any medications, including over the counter meds?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Nothing else? OK. And. In your family, you said no one has asthma or allergic rhinitis or eczema or anything like that, right?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Not asthma, my dad also gets those allergies and irritations just like me.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Uhm, OK. And you mentioned that you're staying with your at your parents place. Are you uh, are you doing things from home? Are you like doing school from home or working from home?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, I'm not currently working, just studying from home.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and have you had contact with anyone who might have been sick?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Traveled anywhere outside the province, recently?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and do you smoke or have you ever smoked?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, never smoked.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Marijuana?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Any recreational drugs?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Nope.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Uh, do you drink alcohol or have you ever had alcohol in the past?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, alcohol I've had like at University, but generally, maybe just on the weekends. Not anything regular.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Alright. OK, well, uh, those are all the questions I had for you. We will do a physical exam now and I'll go talk to my attending and we'll uh come talk to you right after. I guess before before I do So what exactly are you hoping to get out of today's visit?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I just wanted to like I really do you want to become fit and it's just these symptoms are stopping me and kind of affecting my daily routine, so I just wanted to know what I can do to stop like having these symptoms.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Have you ever tried any puffers?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, I haven't.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: No, ok. Right, yeah, let's talk a little bit.

utterances.speaker: control
utterances.text: Add differential diagnosis
